title: Marry Me Chicken Recipe
description: Marry me chicken is a deliciously creamy chicken dish with a rich sun-dried tomato sauce. So quick and easy, you're sure to fall in love with it!
body: ‚Äã Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Pasta Chicken Marry Me Chicken 4.8 (139) 120 Reviews 22 Photos Marry me chicken is saut√©ed chicken in a creamy sun-dried tomato sauce. You can serve it with pasta as suggested or on its own. They say the way to someone's heart is through their stomach, and this is worthy of a marriage proposal! Submitted by thedailygourmet Updated on November 12, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 22 22 22 22 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts fabeveryday Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 ¬Ω pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves 2 tablespoons butter 3 cloves garlic, minced ¬Ω teaspoon dried oregano ¬º teaspoon ground thyme ¬Ω cup chicken broth, divided ¬Ω pound bacon 1 (16 ounce) package angel hair pasta 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour ¬Ω cup freshly shaved Parmesan cheese ¬º cup whipping cream ¬º cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes 1 pinch red pepper flakes salt to taste Directions Gather ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place chicken breasts on a flat work surface. Slice horizontally through the middle, being careful not to cut all the way through to the other side. Open the 2 sides and spread them out like an open book to butterfly. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Melt butter in a large, oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic, oregano, thyme. Saut√© until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add chicken and cook until golden brown but not fully cooked, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour 1/4 cup chicken broth into the skillet and bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the centers and juices run clear, about 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Meanwhile, place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels and let cool enough to handle, about 5 minutes; chop. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios At the same time, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook angel hair pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain and keep warm. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove skillet from the oven and transfer chicken to a plate, reserving juices in the skillet. Keep chicken warm and place skillet on the stovetop. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk flour into the skillet over medium heat. Add remaining chicken broth, Parmesan cheese, and whipping cream. Whisk until combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add sun-dried tomatoes, red pepper flakes, and salt. Add bacon and chicken back into the skillet. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve on top of hot cooked pasta. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tip You can use any kind of pasta that you'd like. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 518 Calories 20g Fat 45g Carbs 40g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 518 % Daily Value * Total Fat 20g 25% Saturated Fat 8g 42% Cholesterol 108mg 36% Sodium 798mg 35% Total Carbohydrate 45g 16% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 2g Protein 40g 79% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 103mg 8% Iron 3mg 19% Potassium 519mg 11% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Marry Me Chicken 01 of 22 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 22 Photo by¬† James LaLiberte 01/29/2025 Made this for the first time last night, and very happy with the result. Relatively simple to make, and has wonderful flavor. I would probably increase chicken stock and other ingredients to create a larger volume of sauce. Would also consider adding artichoke hearts and perhaps some capers.. 03 of 22 Photo by¬† LDMS 06/23/2024 OK with tweaks My son asked me to make this recipe a month or two ago. He absolutely loves it. It‚Äôs easy and Ive tweaked it a bit more each time I make it. Sometimes adding fresh spinach or broccoli. I make his with potato gnocchi!! 04 of 22 Photo by¬† Karrie Nowell 05/18/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort I adjusted a few things but just to make extra sauce 05 of 22 Photo by¬† Eboni Johnson 03/07/2024 Great flavors Worth the effort Easy to follow Only change was that I made extra sauce. Very good. 06 of 22 Photo by¬† ruthgiles 02/23/2024 OK with tweaks Needs more flavor Double the sauce.Add fresh spinach. 07 of 22 Photo by¬† ChirpyBeer5751 01/14/2024 This recipe got A's all across the board from my familyüòãMy son and I made it together to prepare him for the futureüòÑ 08 of 22 Photo by¬† Laura Lou 10/08/2023 I didn't make it exactly after reading some reviews. I just wanted to use one pan so I used bacon grease instead of butter. I added the precooked pasta in the extra sauce at the end. I didn't do the oven thing. I also had boneless skinless chicken thighs. Absolutely delicious. Very flavorful. I hope no one asks me to marry them for food. It would be a loud resounding NO, but thank you! How about dessert? ;-) 09 of 22 Photo by¬† MirthPrawn9417 07/23/2023 I gave this recipe 4 stars because didn‚Äôt have enough sauce. Otherwise this is an excellent dish. It really helps to have all of your ingredients ready. 07/23/2023 10 of 22 Photo by¬† fabeveryday 04/17/2023 This was incredible! Not bland at all. I did salt my chicken before browning, and found that I didn‚Äôt even need to add much to the sauce at all. Per the other reviewers‚Äô recommendations, I also made extra of the sauce. To do this, I tripled the butter, flour, remaining chicken stock (so 1 cup total, with 1/4 going in before baking and 3/4 when making the sauce), and cream, just doubled the cheese (since that was the amount I had), and used a whole 12 ounce pack of bacon. This amount worked well for us with the amount of pasta we used. 1 2 3 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Buffalo Chicken Pasta Bake Chicken Alfredo Bake 18 Ratings Chicken Alfredo with Fettuccini Noodles 298 Ratings Chicken and Asparagus Fettuccine 130 Ratings Easy Chicken Pasta 17 Ratings Spinach and Grilled Chicken Penne 12 Ratings Chicken Alfredo 428 Ratings Fettuccine with Chicken, Leeks, and Gorgonzola 4 Ratings Easy One-Pot Chicken Alfredo 5 Ratings Instant Pot Creamy Chicken and Leek Alfredo 14 Ratings Cajun Chicken Pasta 2,811 Ratings Chicken and Rapini Penne Pasta 1 Rating Not Really Chicken Scampi 9 Ratings Rasta Pasta 127 Ratings Creamy Garlic Chicken Pasta 57 Ratings Chicken Riggies 81 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family.
